communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Registration of all Los Angeles Unified School District In- House Registered Counsel and their Attorneys of record by date. Do include unfinished program assignees and uncompleted registrations or updated attorneys with those out of state or otherwise rejected or failed or removed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

title: Getting 97 Done Report (New York City Mayor's Office Of Climate And Environmental Justice)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of authors involved in preparing the "Getting 97 Done" report published published in September 2023.
A list of private entities contracted to participate in the preparation of the "Getting 97 Done" report.
Copies of contracts with private entities hired to participate in the preparation of the "Getting 97 Done" report.

The aforementioned report can be viewed here: https://climate.cityofnewyork.us/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Getting-_LL97Done.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list of authors involved in preparing the "Getting 97 Done" report published published in September 2023.
A list of private entities contracted to participate in the preparation of the "Getting 97 Done" report.
Copies of contracts with private entities hired to participate in the preparation of the "Getting 97 Done" report.

The aforementioned report can be viewed here: https://climate.cityofnewyork.us/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Getting-_LL97Done.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails and attachments sent or received by Mayor Ed Murray or Staff during the period 1/1/2016–12/31/2017 that contain any of the following (non-case-sensitive) phrases: "secure scheduling", "secured scheduling", "secure schedule", "secured schedule", "secure schedules", or "secured schedules."

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for all emails sent or received by Council Members or Staff during the period 1/1/2016–12/31/2018 that contain any of the following (non-case-sensitive) phrases: "secure scheduling", "secured scheduling", "secure schedule", "secured schedule", "secure schedules", or "secured schedules." The requested metadata includes, but is not limited to, the following email attributes or fields: From, To, Cc, Bcc, Subject, SentDate, ReceivedDate, Size, Attachments, Importance, ReadStatus, ConversationID, Categories, FlagStatus, Sensitivity. I would prefer to receive these records as an electronic spreadsheet (.xlsx or .csv file) with separate rows for each email and separate columns for each attribute.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

> All email correspondences (including attachments) between ICF director of building decarbonization Luke Surowiec and one or more of the following individuals:

> Mayor's Office of Climate and Environmental Justice Executive Director Elijah M. Hutchinson
> Former Mayor's Office of Climate and Environmental Justice Executive Director Lizzie Charles-Guzman
>Former  Mayor’s Office of Climate and Sustainability Director Ben Furnas

Please limit your search to emails sent and received between January 1, 2021 and the date the search is conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

title: Pathways to Carbon-Neutral NYC Study Contract

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

> A copy of the contract with strategic consulting firm ICF that resulted in the publication of the "Pathways to Carbon-Neutral NYC" report published in April 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone
